abstract: The microchip start-up has taken in about $1 million in seed money this year.
snippet: The microchip start-up has taken in about $1 million in seed money this year.
lead_paragraph: Last week at the 2010 D.F.J.-Cisco Global Business Plan Competition, Ambiq Micro, a microchip technology start-up, won a $250,000 investment from Draper Fisher Jurvetson, the venture capital firm, and Cisco. So far this year, according to Scott Hanson, chief executive, Ambiq Micro has taken in $333,000 in awards and cash grants from business plan competitions.

headline.main: Ambiq Micro Wins Another Business Competition
